TopicTitle: Looking for suggestions on categories for KerbalStuff.com

Articles.Content:
I've been chatting with the Drew DeVault, author of the kerbalstuff.com site. While I think it is a great site and he has done a very professional job, I find that the lack of categories makes it less valuable than it otherwise would be.

He is open to merging changes to implement this feature of being able to filter by category.

The Curse site (http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal) has the following categories which seem very reasonable to me:

Command & Control

Gameplay

Miscellaneous

Parts Pack

Physics

Propulsion

Resources

Science

Ship Systems

Structural and Aerodynamic

Sub-assembly

Utility & Navigation

So I have two questions:

1. Would this be of interest to people?

2. Right now there is a large mix of mods for 0.25 and 0.90, which I expect will quickly drop off as more mods get converted to 0.90. Would there be interest on being able to filter by KSP version?

Thanks in advance

LinuxGuruGamer

Oh; yes. I want categories, if only because it let's me know what's in a mod quickly, and if i'm looking for, say, more engines, but not more wings, I can actually find things easier.

Kerbal Stuff is a great site, but to find something you're looking for, it's more like looking through a forest. Sure, it let's you stumble upon new mods easier, but for people who know what they're looking for, it's just annoying. (and it'd be nice to get an "at a glance" look at what a mod offers)

KSP version filters would be nice as well.
